definition: to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: The boy took one sip of the wine and spat it out.
sentences.chinese: 孩子吃掉了药丸外面的糖衣，却把药心吐了出来。

sentences.english: The dog's way of celebrating was to eat part of the pregnancy test kit.
sentences.chinese: 马利吃掉了一部分验孕棒来表达它对此事的庆祝。

sentences.english: As you said, here sure have one remanent chicken leg.
sentences.chinese: 正如你说的一样，这里的确还有一只鸡腿没有吃掉。

sentences.english: Cattle can damage forage crops by eating down to the roots.
sentences.chinese: 牛会把草根吃掉，这样会损害饲料作物。

sentences.english: Sees the Worm, Eats it with one bite.
Claire: You guys, you need to eat your brussel sprouts.
sentences.chinese: 伙计们，你们要把芽甘蓝都吃掉。

sentences.english: One of the recipients has eaten his card already, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 有一个收卡人已经把他的卡吃掉了。

sentences.english: Food stores are frequently ruined by rain or damp, or eaten by mice.
sentences.chinese: 粮库经常被雨水或潮湿毁灭或被老鼠吃掉。

sentences.english: I'm so hungry that I can stodge a sheep.
sentences.chinese: 我太饿了，现在我能吃掉一只羊。

sentences.english: Canada geese and mallard ducks have eaten many of the dead fish。
sentences.chinese: 而这些死鱼中的大部分都被加拿大黑雁与野鸭吃掉了。

sentences.english: Cheek-bone" and "teeth" represent his enemies as wild beasts ready to devour him.
sentences.chinese: “颊骨”和“牙齿”是他的敌人是野兽准备吃掉他。

sentences.english: When we left, there were still about one third of unconsumed food on the table.
sentences.chinese: 结果还有三分之一没有吃掉，剩在桌面上。

sentences.english: In Orthopaedics we can have our "cake and eat it too".
sentences.chinese: 在骨科专业，我们有我们的“蛋糕并吃掉它”。

sentences.english: The insects have chewed up 4 million acres of spruce trees.
sentences.chinese: 这些昆虫能吃掉4百万英亩的云杉树。

sentences.english: After that he rushed at the poor little lamb and ate it up.
sentences.chinese: 说完，他就冲向小山羊，把他吃掉了。

definition: full to the point of bursting/(coll.) at most
to starve to death/to be very hungry
to run away/to take to one's heels
meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130
to eat one's fill/to be full
